business.headline: Sanjay Malhotra's focus as RBI Governor: 3 key areas to watch out forBrokerage firm Nomura anticipates Sanjay Malhotra's tenure as RBI Governor may bring rate cuts, foster credit growth, and allow flexible currency management amid economic challenges.

November blues for mutual funds as equity inflows down 14%: AMFI data Investment through systematic investment plans (SIPs) remained steady in November. Total SIP inflows stood at Rs 25,319.66 crore, showing little change from October's Rs 25,323 crore.

Aditya Birla Group set to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Rajasthan: Kumar Mangalam BirlaAddressing the Rising Rajasthan Summit in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Kumar Mangalam Birla said, "Across our businesses, we are committed to significantly scaling up our investments. I foresee the Group investing over Rs 50,000 crore in the next few years."

Aditya Birla Group to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Rajasthan: Kumar Mangalam BirlaSpeaking at the Rising Rajasthan Summit in the presence of PM Narendra Modi, Kumar Mangalam Birla highlighted the state's potential driven by its mineral wealth, infrastructure, tourism, and renewable energy capacity.

Air India places order to purchase 100 more Airbus aircraftThis new purchase comes in addition to the 470 aircraft already ordered from Airbus and Boeing in 2023, boosting Air India's total Airbus orders this year to 350 aircraft.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trinamool's 'Mamata Banerjee should lead INDIA' finds more backers, rift deepensEver since Mamata Banerjee set off a churn by evincing interest in leading the INDIA bloc last week, several non-Congress leaders have closed ranks behind her, with Lalu Prasad Yadav being the latest addition.

Techie dies by suicide, details harassment by wife in tragic 24-page note, videoA 34-year-old techie died by suicide at his Bengaluru residence, leaving behind a 24-page note blaming his wife and her family for harassment. An FIR has been filed against his wife and relatives following a complaint by his brother.

Supreme Court takes note of High Court judge's controversial remarks at VHP eventChief Justice of India (CJI) Sanjiv Khanna received complaints seeking appropriate action against Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav for his speech targeting a particular community at a VHP event.

BJP slams Arvind Kejriwal over Chief Minister's house, shares video; AAP reactsThe renovation of Delhi Chief Minister's residence incurred a total cost of Rs 52.71 crore, according to a "factual report" submitted by the Delhi government's Vigilance Directorate to the lieutenant governor last year in 2023.

Why techies in India's Silicon Valley Bengaluru should say Krishna, KrishnaSM Krishna, who passed away on Tuesday, developed Karnataka's IT sector during his tenure as the Chief Minister. A farmer's son, Krishna regarded computers and IT as two powerful tools and was instrumental in transforming Bengaluru into India's Silicon Valley.

Video: Bangladeshi politician's boycott India call, burns Jaipur-made bedsheetBNP leader Ruhul Kabir Rizvi ordered party members to burn the India-made bedsheet as a protest against what he described as recent incidents in India that have angered Bangladeshis.

Nurse going to hospital, teen returning home: Victims of Mumbai bus accidentA bus crash in Mumbai's Kurla area on Monday night killed six people, including a Mumbai Bus Accident: 19-year-old teen and a 55-year-old nurse, and left 43 others injured. The driver, Sanjay More, has been arrested. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced compensation for the victims' families.

Elon Musk and Sundar Pichai geek out over Google's new quantum chip Willow  Google on Monday announced Willow, its new quantum chip, which it says has achieved a breakthrough in quantum computing.

Trump calls Trudeau 'Governor of Canada' as tariff war tensions mountTrump's comments about "Governor Trudeau" stemmed from a joke he made during a private dinner earlier this month at his Florida estate, where the two leaders clashed over proposed trade tariffs and border security.

Exclusive: Rs 125 crore in assets returned to victims in Mehul Choksi-PNB scam caseAs per the court's order, the ED initiated the transfer of assets, starting with properties worth Rs 125 crore. This includes flats in Mumbai and factories/godowns in SEEPZ Mumbai.

Will Syria chaos fuel ISIS comeback?Syria was a major base of the Islamic State (IS) terror group. Will the vacuum after the fall of the Assad regime see the growth of the group now contained in small pockets? The antecedents of Syrian rebel leaders like Abu Muhammad al-Jolani make it a real possibility.

When SM Krishna abandoned Congress after 46 years, said party had no futureVeteran politician SM Krishna, who passed away on Tuesday, resigned from the Indian National Congress in 2017 after 46 years of association. Krishna, who is known as the 'Architect of Brand Bengaluru', said the Congress had no future and mentioned how he took the hard decision to protect his self-respect and dignity.

No one was fired: Startup YesMadam apologises for distress caused by viral emailIn a statement issued on social media, YesMadam said that the viral email was a 'planned effort' and denied firing any employees following severe backlash.

Row over Lalu Prasad's vulgar jibe at Nitish Kumar, NDA says he needs helpRJD chief Lalu Yadav sparked controversy on Tuesday with a sexist comment about Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's Mahila Samwad Yatra, suggesting it was intended to "letch at women".

Create more jobs instead of only providing free ration: Supreme Court to CentreThe Supreme Court said the state governments may keep on issuing ration cards to appease the people, since they know that the liability to provide the grains rests with the Centre.

Earth shook violently in 2011 and we still don't know what happenedWhile it remains the strongest earthquake recorded in Japan's history and the third-largest globally since 1900, we still don't know what really caused it.

Kareena's playful face, Saif's spoon tricks: Inside Sharmila Tagore's birthday funVeteran actor Sharmila Tagore celebrated her 80th birthday with a cosy family gathering featuring Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan, Taimur, and others. Soha Ali Khan shared a glimpse of the celebration on social media.

Zeenat Aman reveals how Khaike Paan became a surprise hit after it was rejectedZeenat Aman shared an intriguing story about the iconic Bollywood song Khaike Paan Banaraswala, which became a hit after initially being rejected for another film. The song, featuring Amitabh Bachchan, added a light-hearted moment to the film Don and has left a lasting cultural impact.

Pushpa 2 director Sukumar to attend Ram Charan's Game Changer event in USReports suggest that Pushpa 2 director Sukumar will attend the pre-release event of Ram Charan's Game Changer on December 21, 2024, in Dallas, Texas. Sukumar, who directed Ram Charan in the blockbuster Rangasthalam, will be reuniting with the actor for RC 17.

OTD in 2022: Ishan Kishan smashed the fastest double hundred in ODIs vs BANOn December 10 in 2022, Ishan Kishan smashed the fastest double hundred in the ODI history. At the age of 24, he also became the youngest player to score a double hundred.

Virat Kohli makes critical changes ahead of Gabba Test: Harbhajan breaks it downVirat Kohli made some critical changes in his game ahead of the 3rd Test at the Gabba. Harbhajan Singh pointed out that Kohli was working on his back-foot game to tackle the bounce.

Harbhajan Singh hopes Head-Siraj row ends after ICC sanctions: Enough is enoughFormer spinner Harbhajan Singh is hoping that the Mohammed Siraj-Travis Head has come to an end after both men were given sanctions by the ICC for their actions during the Adelaide Test. Both Siraj and Head were given one demerit point for their actions and the Indian pacer was also fined 20 percent of his match fees.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
